content.body: God hath endued the will of man with that natural liberty, that it is neither forced, nor, by any absolute necessity of nature, determined to good, or evil.
content.name: Confession of Faith
content.title: Chapter 9: Of Free Will

content_with_prooftexts.body: God hath endued the will of man with that natural liberty, that it is neither forced, nor, by any absolute necessity of nature, determined to good, or evil.1
content_with_prooftexts.name: Confession of Faith

prooftexts.1:
Matthew 17:12

But I tell you that Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him, but did to him whatever they pleased. So also the Son of Man will certainly suffer at their hands.”

James 1:14

But each person is tempted when he is lured and enticed by his own desire.

Deuteronomy 30:19

I call heaven and earth to witness against you today, that I have set before you life and death, blessing and curse. Therefore choose life, that you and your offspring may live, (ESV)

content_with_prooftexts.title: Chapter 9: Of Free Will

feed:
Confession of Faith
Chapter 9: Of Free Will

1. God hath endued the will of man with that natural liberty, that it is neither forced, nor, by any absolute necessity of nature, determined to good, or evil.1

  1. Matthew 17:12

    But I tell you that Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him, but did to him whatever they pleased. So also the Son of Man will certainly suffer at their hands.”

    James 1:14

    But each person is tempted when he is lured and enticed by his own desire.

    Deuteronomy 30:19

    I call heaven and earth to witness against you today, that I have set before you life and death, blessing and curse. Therefore choose life, that you and your offspring may live, (ESV)
title: Of free will, part 1
